content.title: Justice Dept. Mistakenly Exposed Cooperating Witnesses in Epstein Files
content.description: The disclosure is the latest example of how the urgent push to release the files led to the government inadvertently publicizing information it would normally keep under wraps.

content.title: How a Close Associate of Epstein’s Found Career Redemption in Japan
content.description: Top Japanese officials are backing a tech and entrepreneurship initiative led by Joichi Ito, whose involvement with Jeffrey Epstein may endanger efforts to get the project off the ground.

content.title: World Economic Forum Chief Resigns Over Epstein Ties
content.description: Borge Brende, a former foreign minister of Norway, had maintained contact with the convicted sex offender.

content.title: Immigration Agents Arrest Student Inside Columbia Building, School Says
content.description: Claire Shipman, the university’s acting president, said that the federal officials had misrepresented themselves to gain access.

content.title: Denver Mayor Bars ICE from City Property and Orders Protection for Protesters
content.description: Mayor Mike Johnston’s order is a defiant shift from his measured stance and risks drawing attention to Greater Denver after President Trump during the campaign promised a “bloody story” there.

content.title: ICE Car Chase Leads to Crash Involving Children, Newark Mayor Says
content.description: The crash happened on Wednesday morning, Mayor Ras Baraka said, as federal immigration agents were pursuing a man driving a van.

content.title: Trump Administration Asks Supreme Court to End Protections for Syrian Migrants
content.description: The president has sought to end the program, known as Temporary Protected Status, for various migrants as part of his mass deportation efforts.

content.title: Mamdani and Trump Are Set to Meet in Washington
content.description: Mayor Zohran Mamdani’s trip to the White House on Thursday was unannounced. The topics he planned to discuss with President Trump were not immediately clear.

content.title: New A.C.A. Plans Could Increase Family Deductibles to $31,000
content.description: The Trump administration is proposing Obamacare plans that it says will lower health insurance premiums. But critics warn they would make care unaffordable.

content.title: U.S. Mortgage Rates Fall Below 6% for First Time in Years
content.description: The evidence is patchy on whether lower rates have meaningfully spurred more activity, as the Trump administration floats measures it says will make housing more affordable.

content.title: Why Are So Many Teen Girls Still Tearing Their A.C.L.s?
content.description: For years, ligament tears have been a crisis among young athletes — even though a few simple exercises can prevent them.

content.title: A Deal or War? U.S. and Iran End Day of Crucial Talks
content.description: President Trump has kept up a steady drumbeat of threats and built up U.S. troops in the region. Iran’s task is to give him a win but also preserve some semblance of nuclear enrichment.

content.title: How Israelis Feel About Another Potential War With Iran
content.description: The national mood is somewhere between anxiety, resignation and anticipation as President Trump considers whether to attack Iran.

content.title: Why Are So Many Democrats Running for California Governor?
content.description: With California’s political machine on the wane, nobody has emerged as a clear front-runner. Democrats worry that nine of their candidates could split the vote and hand Republicans a win.

content.title: In Texas, Crenshaw faces primary challenger, a test for MAGA
content.description: Representative Dan Crenshaw, who has at times clashed with President Trump and his allies, is facing a conservative challenger in Tuesday’s primary.

content.title: China Wants Germany in Its Corner. It’s Not That Easy.
content.description: China’s play for U.S. allies has a problem: As Germany’s leader showed, Europe’s grievances with Beijing may run deeper than its frustration with Trump.

content.title: What We Know About the Gun Battle Off the Coast of Cuba
content.description: Four armed Cubans aboard a Florida-based speedboat died in a gunfight with Cuban border troops on Wednesday, officials said.

content.title: He Hopes to Turn the Island of Nevis Into a Libertarian Paradise, With Crypto
content.description: A Bitcoin baron wants to build a libertarian paradise on the island of Nevis. Democracy is getting in the way.

content.title: Man Arrested in N.Y.C. Snowball Fight That Police Said Injured Officers
content.description: The event, which began playfully, shifted in tone when the police appeared. Mayor Zohran Mamdani has said that the episode did not appear to be a crime, while other officials called for arrests.

content.title: They Helped Women Fight Online Abuse. They Were Barred From the U.S.
content.description: The founders of HateAid, a German human-rights group that helps victims of online attacks, were accused by the Trump administration of being part of a “global censorship-industrial complex.”

content.title: Venezuela’s Capital, Laid Low by Misrule, Is Stirring Back to Life
content.description: New restaurants are popping up in Caracas. Nightclubs are bursting at the seams. The streets are eerily safe — with big exceptions. Could a revival be on the horizon?

content.title: How Texas School Vouchers Could Make Child Care More Affordable
content.description: Republicans have embraced vouchers, while Democrats have criticized them. But as thousands of preschool parents vie for the funds, the state program may help a progressive goal.

content.title: ‘Grease 2,’ the Giddy, Raunchy Flop That Brought Us Michelle Pfeiffer
content.description: The highly anticipated 1982 sequel failed to meet expectations at the time but has since charmed an adoring following with its ambitions dance numbers and nonstop ear worms.

content.title: How A.I.-Generated Videos Are Distorting Your Child’s YouTube Feed
content.description: Experts caution that low-quality, A.I.-generated videos on YouTube geared toward children often feature conflicting information, lack plot structure and can be cognitively overwhelming — all of which could affect young children’s development.

content.title: The Trumpiest Trump We’ve Ever Beheld
content.description: The president is becoming the very thing that destroyed the Democrats: a reality-denying machine.

content.title: The Economy Is a Feeling
content.description: Today, we’re looking at how politicians are framing affordability.

content.title: Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen Calls Snap Elections in Denmark
content.description: Experts say Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen is trying to capitalize on her success standing up to President Trump.

content.title: Israeli Intelligence Agent Charged in Smuggling Goods Into Gaza
content.description: The indictment against an agent of the Shin Bet security agency added to a growing list of Israelis accused of exploiting their positions in the security forces to profit from the war in Gaza.

content.title: Sorry, SpaceX: It’s Getting Too Crowded Up There
content.description: Elon Musk wants to launch a million satellites, but researchers say global warming is changing the upper atmosphere in ways that makes space junk linger.

title: International doctors forced to leave Gaza over Israeli demands
description: Seventeen aid groups have petitioned Israel’s Supreme Court after the government moved to ban 37 NGOs in Gaza.

title: Hillary Clinton calls for Trump to testify at US House Epstein hearing
description: The former secretary of state accused the Republican-led panel of seeking to protect political allies in probe.

title: India and Israel pledge to boost cooperation on trade, defence
description: Narendra Modi's visit to Israel has drawn criticism at home amid tensions over Israel's genocidal war on Gaza.

title: Blood tech: UK’s use of Israeli spyware that helps underpin a genocide
description: Despite its public objections to Israel's actions, the UK is buying spyware developed and tested on Palestinians.

title: Afghanistan says it launches attacks against Pakistan
description: Afghan military source tells Al Jazeera 13 border outposts were captured as Pakistan denies that any posts were seized.

title: India beat Zimbabwe by 72 runs to chase T20 World Cup semifinal spot
description: India knocked out a defiant Zimbabwe in a high-scoring match in Chennai to keep alive their chances of making the semis.

title: Trump U-turn: Is Venezuelan oil really available to Cuba again?
description: The US says it will licence entities to sell the oil to Cuba except those linked to the Cuban government and military.

title: From Gaza to defence: Five key takeaways from Indian PM Modi’s Israel visit
description: Indian PM throws his weight behind Israel's Netanyahu even as genocide continues in occupied Palestinian territory.

title: Epstein and the politics of distraction
description: Scandal individualises corruption, creating a spectacle that redirects anger away from structural power.

title: Gaza mother recognises missing son on Israeli ‘for sale’ post
description: A mother from Gaza says she recognised her missing son listed as ‘for sale’ in a post shared by Israeli soldiers.

title: What is Greater Israel, and how popular is it among Israelis?
description: Recent US and Israeli comments on 'Greater Israel' trigger regional concerns over sovereignty and territorial expansion.

title: Kim Jong Un oversees massive Pyongyang military parade
description: Kim Jong Un oversaw a massive military parade in Pyongyang to wrap up the once every-five-years Workers' Party congress.

title: World Economic Forum head Borge Brende quits after Epstein links revealed
description: The World Economic Forum boss, a former Norwegian foreign minister, had dinners and exchanged messages with Epstein.

title: Has Trump’s trade strategy lost leverage?
description: A Supreme Court setback on tariffs challenges Trump's protectionist trade strategy.

title: Global impunity fuels Israel’s illegal push to annex West Bank: Amnesty
description: Rights group slams international failure to deter Israel’s escalating annexation, apartheid policies in the West Bank.

title: Who is really safe in India and Israel?
description: Not even all Hindus and Jews find safety in the countries supposedly built to protect them.

title: India-Israel axis: What are the IMEC corridor, I2U2 grouping Modi spoke of?
description: During his Knesset speech in Jerusalem, Modi mentioned multilateral projects on which India and Israel collaborate.

title: ElevenLabs CEO says voice AI will change everything. Can it be controlled?
description: From restoring speech to deepfakes, Mati Staniszewski talks about where voice AI crosses the line.

title: How Trump’s 2026 Iran ‘war’ script echoes and twists the 2003 Iraq playbook
description: Echoes of 2003: How Trump is using conflicting intel and homeland threats to justify a new escalation with Iran.

title: More than 1,000 UK councillors sign Palestine pledge as local polls loom
description: The campaign aims to pressure local authorities to divest from Israeli weapons manufacturers.

title: Cartels, Chaos & the 2026 World Cup
description: Cartels, Chaos & the 2026 World Cup

title: Israeli forces fired 900 bullets at Gaza medical convoy, new report reveals
description: A new report found that Israeli soldiers fired over 900 bullets at Palestinian aid workers in March 2025, killing 15.

title: Denmark’s PM Mette Frederiksen calls parliamentary election on March 24
description: Announcement comes as Frederiksen aims to build on rising support for her stance against US efforts to seize Greenland.

title: Video: Palestinians in Gaza overcome hardships to celebrate Ramadan
description: Ahmed Abu Naji is one of millions of Palestinians in Gaza who are clinging onto the traditions of Ramadan.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo buys 25 percent stake in Spanish second-tier club Almeria
description: Almeria, relegated from La Liga in 2023-24, had been under the control of Saudi owners for more than six years.

content: Arrivals at the Rock's airport would have to show their passport twice under a new UK-EU treaty.
The 52-year-old is serving a life sentence after being convicted of murdering schoolgirls Holly Wells and Jessica Chapman.
A committee of MPs and peers says the government has confirmed it will not overrule any decision to disclose files.
A former neighbour of Valdo Calocane was told he could have killed her, years before the attacks.
The indirect negotiations in Geneva are seen as a last-ditch effort, but the chances of a nuclear agreement are unclear.
Her Turner Prize-nominated messy bed caused a stir in the late 1990s and is now going back on display.
Bills to let terminally ill people end their life are being considered at Westminster and in Scotland.
Ex-Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn's supporters won 14 of the 24 seats on Your Party's central executive committee (CEC).
People at the start of their careers are particularly affected by the UK's weak job market.
Russia's announcement comes as Ukraine's top negotiator met US peace envoys in Geneva.
Rachel Duffy has spoken publicly for the first time about winning The Traitors and then losing her mother.
Stars of the hit Netflix show talk about the importance of representation as part two of season four lands.
A ban on new holiday homes sees more permanent residents but some say the policy harms tourism.
Whether it's a Saturday job or your first full-time role, here are some expert tips to help you get on the career ladder.
There were 4,793 people sleeping on the streets on a single night last autumn.
Introducing dedicated parking bays has not completely solved the issue.
Queen's University Belfast says there were more than 10,500 visits by students to its food bank in the students' union.
Use our interactive tracker to explore the latest migration statistics for the UK
The Prince and Princess of Wales arrive to cheers from crowds that had gathered outside despite the rain
A "distasteful joke" by US President Donald Trump overshadows the achievement of female athletes at the Winter Olympics, says USA ice hockey gold medallist Hilary Knight.
Safety campaigners say Meta is "passing the buck" with its new feature for parents using Instagram's teen supervision tools.
The issue of Greenland, which Donald Trump wants to annex, is likely to dominate the election campaign.
Israeli forces blocked Palestinian ambulances while a 14-year-old lay bleeding for at least 45 minutes.
The remains of 14-year-old Celeste Rivas Hernandez were found in the singer's car last year.
Water super-heated by rocks will also provide the UK's first domestic supply of the critical mineral lithium.
Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests
US-Iran talks continue but what will Trump do?
Can the president’s record breaking speech change voters’ minds ahead of the midterms?
Defending champions India pile on 256-4 as they eliminate Zimbabwe from the T20 World Cup with victory in Chennai.
Chelsea recorded a pre-tax loss of £355m for 2024-25 - the highest loss ever made by an English football club - according to financial figures released by Uefa. How did it happen?
A "distasteful joke" by US President Donald Trump overshadows the achievement of female athletes at the Winter Olympics, says USA ice hockey gold medallist Hilary Knight.
A radical new structure for English rugby is set to be rubber-stamped by the RFU, with the Prem separating from the rest of the pyramid, and promotion and relegation scrapped.
